item.title: Pill: Problems in Azure DevOps Pipelines due to Shallow Fetch
item.description: In Azure DevOps, pipelines are a fundamental component for automating the build and release process. One of the key optimizations in these pipelines is the use of shallow fetch when cloning repositories. Unlike a full clone, which downloads the entire history of the repository, a shallow fetch retrieves only the specific commit needed for the build. This is a really welcomed feature, because repositories can contain years of history, or they can have some big file committed by error in some older commit.
